story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a beautiful forest filled with all sorts of creatures. In this forest lived a curious and kind little boy named Finn. Finn didn't have any family or friends, but he wasn't lonely. He spent his days exploring the forest, discovering new things, and helping the creatures who lived there.

One day, Finn came across a small bird with a broken wing. He gently picked up the bird and carried it back to his home, where he made a cozy bed for it and tended to its injury. For many days, Finn cared for the bird, feeding it and keeping it warm, until its wing was healed.

The bird, whose name was Sky, was so grateful to Finn that she wanted to thank him in a special way. She told Finn that she was a magical bird and that she could grant him one wish.

Finn thought for a moment and then said, "I wish that I could help all of the creatures in this forest, not just you."

Sky smiled and granted Finn's wish. From that day forward, Finn had the power to heal any animal that was sick or injured. He spent his days traveling through the forest, using his gift to help all of the creatures who lived there.

The creatures of the forest were so grateful to Finn that they made him their king. Finn ruled over the forest with kindness and wisdom, always looking out for the well-being of his subjects.

But even as king, Finn never forgot his humble beginnings. He continued to explore the forest, always seeking out new adventures and discovering new things.

And so, Finn lived happily ever after, using his gift to help the creatures of the forest and exploring the beauty of the world around him.

As Finn drifted off to sleep, he realized that he didn't need a god or a higher power to give his life meaning. He found joy and purpose in helping others and exploring the world around him. And that was enough for him.

The end.

Good night, sweet prince. May your dreams be filled with wonder and adventure.
